Description: An hippopotamus ivory bangle: slightly oval in shape, with a single knob in the form of a serpent's head. The outer rim of the bangle is bevelled in places but is not completely even, and the inner face is flat.
Curator's comments: Also from burial: shells (1929,1015.64). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 6, 29; pls. XIII, 16; XXII, 28; Grave register, pl. VII; E. Massoulard, ‘Préhistoire et Protohistoire d’ Égypte’ (Paris, 1949), pl. X, 20.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (18)
